pages.description: Strategic opportunity during the Swedish summer offensive

panels.scene: Wide establishing view of Swedish columns advancing through the Ostrobothnian summer landscape toward Nykarleby.
panels.narration: During the summer offensive of 1808, Carl Johan Adlercreutz saw an opportunity to encircle the Russian main army at Nykarleby.

panels.scene: Overview showing Russian forces positioned in and around the town of Nykarleby.
panels.narration: The Russian forces were stationed in and around the town.

panels.scene: Russian troops inside Nykarleby preparing to evacuate, forming marching columns and loading supplies.
panels.narration: Before the Swedish plan could succeed, the Russians ordered a retreat toward Vaasa.

panels.scene: A smaller Russian unit remains behind near the town center as the main force departs.
panels.narration: A rearguard was left behind, led by the officer Jankovitch.

panels.scene: Swedish troops advancing at dawn on Midsummer Eve, river and town visible ahead.
panels.narration: The Swedish offensive began on Midsummer Eve.

panels.scene: Russian rearguard pulling back across the bridge in Nykarleby town center.
panels.narration: Jankovitch withdrew his rearguard across the bridge.

panels.scene: The bridge engulfed in flames, smoke rising over the river.
panels.narration: The bridge was burned to stop the Swedish advance.

panels.scene: Georg Carl von Döbeln at the riverbank, furious as the Russians escape.
panels.narration: Seeing the Russians escape and the surprise attack fail, Döbeln was seized by anger.

panels.scene: Döbeln charging into the river, water rising around him.
panels.narration: In his fury, he ran straight into the river.

panels.scene: Soldiers of the Pori Regiment follow Döbeln into the river, struggling against the current.
Döbeln losing his footing, nearly submerged by the current.
Soldiers reaching for Döbeln in the water.
Döbeln pulled back to the riverbank by his men.
panels.narration: His men managed to rescue him.

panels.scene: Swedish troops resting in Nykarleby, weapons stacked and tension eased.
panels.narration: With the Russians retreating, the Swedes stopped in Nykarleby.

panels.scene: Local inhabitants offering food and drink to Swedish soldiers.
panels.narration: The inhabitants generously offered food and drink as Midsummer was celebrated.

panels.scene: Evening view of Nykarleby and the river, calm and quiet after the events.
panels.narration: The Battle of Nykarleby became a relatively bloodless engagement.
